Return a list of photos matching some criteria.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: A free text search. Photos who's title, description or tags contain the text will be returned. You can exclude results that match a term by prepending it with a - character.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of tags. Photos with one or more of the tags listed will be returned. You can exclude results that match a term by prepending it with a - character.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The NSID of the user who's photo to search. If this parameter isn't passed then everybody's public photos will be searched. A value of "me" will search against the calling user's photos for authenticated calls.

parameters.name: minUploadDate
parameters.description: Minimum upload date. Photos with an upload date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a unix timestamp or mysql datetime.

parameters.name: maxUploadDate
parameters.description: Maximum upload date. Photos with an upload date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a unix timestamp or mysql datetime.

parameters.name: minTakenDate
parameters.description: Minimum taken date. Photos with an taken date greater than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a mysql datetime or unix timestamp.

parameters.name: maxTakenDate
parameters.description: Maximum taken date. Photos with an taken date less than or equal to this value will be returned. The date can be in the form of a mysql datetime or unix timestamp.

parameters.name: license
parameters.description: The license id for photos (for possible values see the flickr.photos.licenses.getInfo method). Multiple licenses may be comma-separated.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The order in which to sort returned photos. Deafults to date-posted-desc (unless you are doing a radial geo query, in which case the default sorting is by ascending distance from the point specified). The possible values are:
  date-posted-asc,
  date-posted-desc,
  date-taken-asc,
  date-taken-desc,
  interestingness-desc,
  interestingness-asc, and
  relevance.

parameters.name: privacyFilter
parameters.description:
Return photos only matching a certain privacy level. This only applies when making an authenticated call to view photos you own. Valid values are:,
  1: public photos,
  2: private photos visible to friends,
  3: private photos visible to family,
  4: private photos visible to friends & family,
  5: completely private photos

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of 4 values defining the Bounding Box of the area that will be searched.

parameters.name: accuracy
parameters.description:
Recorded accuracy level of the location information. Current range is 1-16:
  World level is 1
  Country is ~3
  Region is ~6
  City is ~11
  Street is ~16

parameters.name: safeSearch
parameters.description:
Safe search setting:
  1: for safe,
  2: for moderate,
  3: for restricted

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
Content Type setting:
  1: photos only.
  2: screenshots only.
  3: 'other' only.
  4: photos and screenshots.
  5: screenshots and 'other'.
  6: photos and 'other'.
  7: photos, screenshots, and 'other' (all).

parameters.name: machineTags
parameters.description: Aside from passing in a fully formed machine tag, there is a special syntax for searching on specific properties : Find photos using the 'dc' namespace : "machine_tags" => "dc:" Find photos with a title in the 'dc' namespace : "machine_tags" => "dc:title=" Find photos titled "mr. camera" in the 'dc' namespace : "machine_tags" => "dc:title=\"mr. camera\" Find photos whose value is "mr. camera" : "machine_tags" => "*:*=\"mr. camera\"" Find photos that have a title, in any namespace : "machine_tags" => "*:title=" Find photos that have a title, in any namespace, whose value is "mr. camera" : "machine_tags" => "*:title=\"mr. camera\"" Find photos, in the 'dc' namespace whose value is "mr. camera" : "machine_tags" => "dc:*=\"mr. camera\"" Multiple machine tags may be queried by passing a comma-separated list. The number of machine tags you can pass in a single query depends on the tag mode (AND or OR) that you are querying with. "AND" queries are limited to (16) machine tags. "OR" queries are limited to (8).

parameters.name: machineTagMode
parameters.description: Either 'any' for an OR combination of tags, or 'all' for an AND combination. Defaults to 'any' if not specified.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: The id of a group who's pool to search. If specified, only matching photos posted to the group's pool will be returned.

parameters.name: contacts
parameters.description: Search your contacts. Either 'all' or 'ff' for just friends and family. (Experimental)

parameters.name: woeId
parameters.description: A 32-bit identifier that uniquely represents spatial entities. (not used if bbox argument is present).

parameters.name: placeId
parameters.description: A Flickr place id. (not used if bbox argument is present). Geo queries require some sort of limiting agent in order to prevent the database from crying. This is basically like the check against "parameterless searches" for queries without a geo component. A tag, for instance, is considered a limiting agent as are user defined min_date_taken and min_date_upload parameters — If no limiting factor is passed we return only photos added in the last 12 hours (though we may extend the limit in the future).

parameters.name: media
parameters.description: Filter results by media type. Possible values are all (default), photos or videos

parameters.name: hasGeo
parameters.description: Any photo that has been geotagged, or if the value is "0" any photo that has not been geotagged. Geo queries require some sort of limiting agent in order to prevent the database from crying. This is basically like the check against "parameterless searches" for queries without a geo component. A tag, for instance, is considered a limiting agent as are user defined min_date_taken and min_date_upload parameters — If no limiting factor is passed we return only photos added in the last 12 hours (though we may extend the limit in the future).

parameters.name: geoContext
parameters.description: Geo context is a numeric value representing the photo's geotagginess beyond latitude and longitude. For example, you may wish to search for photos that were taken "indoors" or "outdoors". The current list of context IDs is: 0, not defined. 1, indoors. 2, outdoors. Geo queries require some sort of limiting agent in order to prevent the database from crying. This is basically like the check against "parameterless searches" for queries without a geo component. A tag, for instance, is considered a limiting agent as are user defined min_date_taken and min_date_upload parameters — If no limiting factor is passed we return only photos added in the last 12 hours (though we may extend the limit in the future).

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: A valid latitude, in decimal format, for doing radial geo queries. Geo queries require some sort of limiting agent in order to prevent the database from crying. This is basically like the check against "parameterless searches" for queries without a geo component. A tag, for instance, is considered a limiting agent as are user defined min_date_taken and min_date_upload parameters — If no limiting factor is passed we return only photos added in the last 12 hours (though we may extend the limit in the future).

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: A valid longitude, in decimal format, for doing radial geo queries. Geo queries require some sort of limiting agent in order to prevent the database from crying. This is basically like the check against "parameterless searches" for queries without a geo component. A tag, for instance, is considered a limiting agent as are user defined min_date_taken and min_date_upload parameters — If no limiting factor is passed we return only photos added in the last 12 hours (though we may extend the limit in the future).

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: A valid radius used for geo queries, greater than zero and less than 20 miles (or 32 kilometers), for use with point-based geo queries. The default value is 5 (km).

parameters.name: radiusUnits
parameters.description: The unit of measure when doing radial geo queries. Valid options are "mi" (miles) and "km" (kilometers). The default is "km".

parameters.name: isCommons
parameters.description: Limit the scope of the search to only photos that are part of the Flickr Commons project. Default is false.

parameters.name: inGallery
parameters.description: Limit the scope of the search to only photos that are in a gallery? Default is false, search all photos.

parameters.name: isGetty
parameters.description: Limit the scope of the search to only photos that are for sale on Getty. Default is false.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Number of photos to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

methods.description: Returns next and previous photos for a photo in a set
Returns the albums belonging to the specified user
Returns a list of photos in an album.
Echos the input parameters back in the response
Uploads a new photo to Flickr

apiDescription: A subset of Flickr's API defined in Swagger format.
